fields_of_interest: Education and training, Energy, Environment, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
Ecodesign and Energy Labelling Directives, 
Low Carbon Economy Roadmap, Climate and energy policy including 2030 targets and strategy, international climate 
negotiations and agreements.
organisation_name: International Network for Sustainable Energy - Europe (INFORSE-Europe)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Eco-Design Consultation Forum/ Enterprise and Industry + Energy#E01798#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1798#Member#C#Consultation Forum Sub-group 'Compliance'
membership:
INFORSE-Europe is one of the regions of INFORSE. INFORSE-Europe is following the INFORSE Charter, but it has its own bylaws and it is independently registered.  INFORSE-Europe is working together on the Ecodesign Directive with other NGOs and is founding member of the Coolproducts Campaign. 
INFORSE-Europe participates in the Community Energy Coalition with other promoters of local, sustainable energy solutions
goals__remit:
INFORSE - International Network for Sustainable Energy 
INFORSE-Europe lobbies to promote sustainable energy solutions - renewable energy and energy efficiency - which utilise decentralised approaches. All activities 
seek to protect the environment, and to achieve development. The members are NGOs working on grassroots level as well as on national, regional 
and international levels, all united on a common strategy for a long- term sustainable development with phasing out of nuclear and fossil energy use. The INFORSE network is facilitating practical and political exchange of experiences among NGOs, liaising with concerned multilateral agencies, creating political and 
public awareness, and seeking support for NGO activities.
relevant_communication:
Commenting on Ecodesign regulation together with other organisations in the Coolproducts Campaign Promote transition to renewable energy, nationally and on EU-level, to pave the way for EU energy and climate targets and policies. Publish Sustainable Energy News. 
EU policy pages on website www.inforse.org/europe 
Seminars and events together with members, nationally an on EU level (in 2017 and 2017 one European seminar/event each year, 3 national events each year including. This includes in 2018 participation in the EU Sustainable Energy Week.
